post.body: anyone know how to edit user info?
I have a site I'm trying to get to work at http://127.0.0.1:43110/178s29ameX271Vjj6f6vGXMNNtLKCmD4tj tells me no peers found when I check from my other local computers. Can you get it to work?

Is there a developer or tech support forum?
I'm wondering how I can script the site updates, so I don't have to manually copy paste the private key every time I want to update my website. Especially considering that it can be several mini sites deep.
Updated my website, now has intro teaser with some secrets of the cosmos http://127.0.0.1:43110/178s29ameX271Vjj6f6vGXMNNtLKCmD4tj
Where can I get a list of the ZeroMe hubs. I'm not able to see some peoples profiles, and I understand that means I have to add their hubs.  But I haven't been able to find the list of them.

Is it possible for ZeroMe to support something like pump.io?
I'm used to having my bots post for me on social networks -- don't like using web interfaces. 
So would like to have a bot or api interface to zerome/zeronet if
 possible.

您 活的 中文 国家 题?

are the people using it from China?
Or simply north americans writing in Chinese?

I'm considering forgiving Christianity for taking over my celtic castle around 600CE.
What do you think? Is it worth it?

comment.body: @Sirenyc:  Thanks, always good to get some documentation
@tkarita:  Thanks, seems to have been really effective! :-D
@Durand: I'm not sure what you mean, I'm sharing my content. I know what is in it..

I figured out a temporary workaround for my scripts. 
Can do:
```
echo "privkey" | xclip -sel clip

xclip puts the private key in the paste buffer, so simply have to paste it when the prompt comes up. 
And can do multiple xclips in a row for multiple websites. 

Also at the end of the script can clean your paste buffer, so you don't accidentally paste your private key somewhere:
```
echo "" | xclip -sel clip
```
@Durand: Awesome, thanks, that did the trick :-D

@0face:  well it is all text, I can give you the current top of the page, mostly table of contents. otherwise I'm not sure how to include images in zerome posts (if it is even possible). 

Green Buddhism: A Programmer’s Religion
Logan Streondj elspru@zeroid.bit

Contents
1 Galaxy Domain Strategy
 1.1 About
  1.1.1 Disclaimer
 1.2 Origination
 1.3 Soul World
 1.4 Mission
  1.4.1 What is your private mission?
  1.4.2 What is our public mission?
  1.4.3 Initial Steps
 1.5 History
  1.5.1 Fermi Paradox
  1.5.2 What about other extraterrestrials?
 1.6 Electronic Bodies
2 Links
 2.1 on ZeroNet
 2.2 Contact
 2.3 other websites

I've been dreaming about something like ZeroNet for over a decade -- I even once made a bug request on gentoo that the source files be hosted on a bittorrent like network. 

Every few years I check out what the options are. I tried freenet, but it was too slow. There "is" MaidSafe but it still seems to be vapourware. 
My most recent search I came across Project Maelstrom, I had a hunch that there must be an open source alternative, and viola: ZeroNet!

One reason I'm interested in something like ZeroNet is DAO, Distributed Autonomous Organization.  In particular robot companies, or companies run by robots.  Such as AGI projects, and companies that make robot software and hardware.
With a place like ZeroNet can have true resiliency.
I figured it out, I simply modified the address, so that I would load the hub. and then I can see the profile :-D.
@weakish: thank you, can I preview the user list on a hub?
I think ZeroNet has already done better than MaidSafe claimed it would achieve.
